availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hopkinsville, Kentucky, attorney. Alabama native. Married Mary E. Rogers. Father of Alexander Rogers, Mary J. Rogers, and Luminea Rogers. Attorney in Hopkinsville in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Hopkinsville in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Town of Hopkinsville, p. 33; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Town of Hopkinsville, p. 25; Find A Grave, "A D Rogers ( - 1865)," Memorial #89559623, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=89559623 (accessed September 14, 2017).
